title: A Court of Thorns and Roses
author: Sarah J. Maas
synopsis: A mortal huntress is taken to the faerie lands after killing a wolf, only to discover ancient curses, deadly politics, and a dangerous love.
cover_path: Books/Book-covers/A Court of Thorns and Roses.jpg

title: The Name of the Wind
author: Patrick Rothfuss
synopsis: A legendary magician named Kvothe recounts his childhood in a traveling troupe, his years as a street urchin, and his daring education at a magic university.

title: Mistborn: The Final Empire
author: Brandon Sanderson
synopsis: In a world of ash and mist ruled by an immortal tyrant, a street thief discovers she is a rare magic user and joins a crew planning an impossible heist.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
synopsis: A reluctant hobbit leaves his quiet home to help a band of dwarves reclaim their mountain and treasure from a dragon.

title: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
synopsis: A young hobbit receives a powerful ring and joins a fellowship tasked with destroying it to stop a rising dark lord.

title: A Game of Thrones
author: George R.R. Martin
synopsis: Noble families vie for control of a contested throne as an ancient supernatural threat gathers in the frozen north.

title: Six of Crows
author: Leigh Bardugo
synopsis: A criminal prodigy assembles a crew of outcasts to pull off a dangerous heist in a heavily fortified ice prison.

title: The Lies of Locke Lamora
author: Scott Lynch
synopsis: A gifted con artist and his gang of thieves become entangled in a deadly power struggle in a Venice-like fantasy city.

title: The Way of Kings
author: Brandon Sanderson
synopsis: On a storm-battered world, a broken soldier, a troubled scholar, and a conflicted leader shape the fate of empires and ancient magic.

title: The City of Brass
author: S.A. Chakraborty
synopsis: A conwoman in 18th‑century Cairo accidentally summons a djinn warrior and is pulled into the politics and secrets of a magical city.

title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
synopsis: A lone astronaut wakes up on a starship with no memory and must solve an interstellar mystery to save Earth.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
synopsis: The heir of a noble house is thrust into political and ecological conflict on a desert planet that produces a vital spice.

title: Neuromancer
author: William Gibson
synopsis: A washed‑up hacker is hired for one last dangerous job in a world of cyberspace, AI, and corporate intrigue.

title: Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
synopsis: A mathematician predicts the fall of a galactic empire and founds a group to preserve knowledge and shorten the coming dark age.

title: The Left Hand of Darkness
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
synopsis: An envoy from an interstellar alliance travels to a frozen world whose inhabitants have a unique, fluid approach to gender.

title: Hyperion
author: Dan Simmons
synopsis: Seven pilgrims journey to a distant world, each with a haunting story tied to a mysterious creature known as the Shrike.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
synopsis: A teenager volunteers to take her sister’s place in a deadly televised arena where children fight to the death.

title: The Three-Body Problem
author: Liu Cixin
synopsis: Scientists and gamers become entangled in a secret project linked to first contact with an alien civilization.

title: Annihilation
author: Jeff VanderMeer
synopsis: An all‑female expedition enters a quarantined wilderness where the laws of nature no longer apply.

title: Illuminae
author: Amie Kaufman & Jay Kristoff
synopsis: Two teens fight to survive on fleeing starships after their planet is attacked, while a rogue AI and spreading infection threaten everyone aboard.

title: Outlander
author: Diana Gabaldon
synopsis: A married nurse from 1945 is transported to 18th‑century Scotland, where she falls in love with a Highland warrior.

title: The Time Traveler's Wife
author: Audrey Niffenegger
synopsis: A woman’s life is entwined with a man who involuntarily time travels, causing a nonlinear and often painful love story.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
synopsis: A witty young woman navigates love, class, and misunderstandings with a seemingly proud gentleman in Regency England.

title: The Notebook
author: Nicholas Sparks
synopsis: An elderly man recounts the lifelong love story between a poor country boy and a wealthy young woman.

title: Me Before You
author: Jojo Moyes
synopsis: A quirky caretaker forms a deep bond with a once‑adventurous man now living with quadriplegia after an accident.

title: Red, White & Royal Blue
author: Casey McQuiston
synopsis: The First Son of the United States falls for a British prince after a public rivalry forces them into a fake friendship.

title: The Hating Game
author: Sally Thorne
synopsis: Two office rivals locked in a promotion battle slowly realize their mutual loathing hides a strong attraction.

title: The Love Hypothesis
author: Ali Hazelwood
synopsis: A PhD student pretends to date a grumpy professor, only for their fake relationship to become disarmingly real.

title: Book Lovers
author: Emily Henry
synopsis: A driven literary agent and a brooding editor keep crossing paths in a small town getaway neither of them really wanted.

title: The Night Circus
author: Erin Morgenstern
synopsis: Two rival magicians, bound to a deadly competition, fall in love as their enchanted circus becomes the stage for their duel.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
synopsis: A journalist and a brilliant hacker investigate a decades‑old disappearance tied to a powerful family’s secrets.
cover_path: Books/Book-covers/The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo.jpg

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
synopsis: A woman’s sudden disappearance turns into a media circus while her husband becomes the prime suspect amid twisted revelations.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
synopsis: A symbologist and a cryptologist race across Europe to solve a murder intertwined with religious conspiracies.

title: Murder on the Orient Express
author: Agatha Christie
synopsis: Detective Hercule Poirot must solve a murder aboard a snowbound luxury train where every passenger seems suspicious.

title: Big Little Lies
author: Liane Moriarty
synopsis: Several mothers in a seaside town become linked by a school incident, simmering tensions, and a shocking death.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
synopsis: A psychotherapist becomes obsessed with understanding why a famous painter stopped speaking after allegedly killing her husband.

title: Sharp Objects
author: Gillian Flynn
synopsis: A reporter returns to her hometown to cover the murder of young girls while confronting her own disturbing past.

title: The 7½ Deaths of Evelyn Hardcastle
author: Stuart Turton
synopsis: A man relives the same day in different bodies at a country estate party, tasked with solving a woman’s murder.

title: The Thursday Murder Club
author: Richard Osman
synopsis: Four retirees in a peaceful village meet weekly to study cold cases until they stumble into a very real murder.

title: The Maid
author: Nita Prose
synopsis: A socially awkward hotel maid becomes the focus of suspicion when she discovers a wealthy guest dead in his suite.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
synopsis: A struggling writer becomes winter caretaker of a remote hotel where supernatural forces prey on his family.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
synopsis: A group of people band together to stop an ancient vampire who seeks to spread his curse to England.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
synopsis: A scientist animates a being from dead body parts, only to be horrified by his creation and the consequences.

title: Mexican Gothic
author: Silvia Moreno-Garcia
synopsis: A glamorous young woman travels to a decaying mansion in rural Mexico to check on her cousin’s unsettling new marriage.

title: The Haunting of Hill House
author: Shirley Jackson
synopsis: Guests join a paranormal investigator at an infamous mansion, where the house itself seems to react to them.

title: Bird Box
author: Josh Malerman
synopsis: A mysterious presence drives people to madness if seen, forcing survivors to navigate a devastated world blindfolded.

title: The Only Good Indians
author: Stephen Graham Jones
synopsis: Four Native American men face a vengeful entity tied to a transgression from their youth.

title: House of Leaves
author: Mark Z. Danielewski
synopsis: A family’s new home reveals impossible interior spaces, documented in a manuscript that warps reality for those who read it.

title: The Fisherman
author: John Langan
synopsis: Two widowers bonding over fishing discover a cursed reservoir with a history of eldritch horrors.

title: The Cabin at the End of the World
author: Paul Tremblay
synopsis: A family’s vacation at a remote cabin is interrupted by strangers who claim a ritual sacrifice is needed to prevent the apocalypse.
cover_path: Books/Book-covers/The Cabin at the End of the World.jpg

title: Jurassic Park
author: Michael Crichton
synopsis: A theme park featuring cloned dinosaurs turns deadly when the creatures escape their enclosures.

title: Ready Player One
author: Ernest Cline
synopsis: A teen competes in a virtual reality treasure hunt whose prize is control of a global online world.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
synopsis: An astronaut stranded on Mars must use engineering and botany to survive until rescue is possible.

title: The Bourne Identity
author: Robert Ludlum
synopsis: An amnesiac man discovers he has deadly skills and a dangerous past as he is hunted across Europe.

title: The Black Company
author: Glen Cook
synopsis: An elite mercenary company chronicles its campaigns while serving a powerful and morally ambiguous sorceress.

title: Trail of Lightning
author: Rebecca Roanhorse
synopsis: In a post‑apocalyptic Navajo reservation, a monster hunter with clan powers tracks down newly awakened horrors.

title: Leviathan Wakes
author: James S. A. Corey
synopsis: A down‑on‑his‑luck captain and a detective uncover a conspiracy involving a dangerous alien protomolecule.

title: The Bone Ships
author: RJ Barker
synopsis: Outcasts crew a ship built from dragon bones to hunt a newly sighted sea dragon and change their nation’s fate.

title: Seven Deadly Wonders
author: Matthew Reilly
synopsis: A special forces team races to collect pieces of an ancient device hidden at the Seven Wonders of the World.

title: The Lost City of Z
author: David Grann
synopsis: A journalist retraces the doomed Amazon expedition of a British explorer obsessed with finding a fabled city.

title: Watchmen
author: Alan Moore & Dave Gibbons
synopsis: Former costumed heroes investigate a conspiracy while confronting their own flawed morality in an alternate Cold War America.

title: V for Vendetta
author: Alan Moore & David Lloyd
synopsis: A masked vigilante wages a one‑man war against a fascist regime in a near‑future Britain.

title: Saga, Vol. 1
author: Brian K. Vaughan & Fiona Staples
synopsis: Star‑crossed lovers from warring species try to protect their newborn daughter while fleeing soldiers and bounty hunters.

title: Sandman: Preludes & Nocturnes
author: Neil Gaiman
synopsis: The personification of Dream escapes decades of imprisonment and begins reclaiming his lost tools and realm.

title: Batman: The Dark Knight Returns
author: Frank Miller
synopsis: An aging Bruce Wayne comes out of retirement to fight crime in a dystopian Gotham City.

title: Maus
author: Art Spiegelman
synopsis: A cartoonist portrays his father’s Holocaust experiences and their strained relationship using animal metaphors.

title: Persepolis
author: Marjane Satrapi
synopsis: A young girl comes of age during and after the Iranian Revolution, told in stark black‑and‑white comics.

title: Bone, Vol. 1: Out from Boneville
author: Jeff Smith
synopsis: Three cousins lost in a mysterious valley encounter talking animals, ancient prophecies, and encroaching darkness.

title: Mind MGMT, Vol. 1
author: Matt Kindt
synopsis: A writer investigating a bizarre airline incident uncovers a secret government program of psychic agents.

title: Doom Patrol by Grant Morrison, Vol. 1
author: Grant Morrison & Richard Case
synopsis: A team of misfit heroes confront surreal threats that challenge both reality and sanity.
cover_path: Books/Book-covers/Doom Patrol by Grant Morrison, Vol. 1.jpg

title: Fullmetal Alchemist, Vol. 1
author: Hiromu Arakawa
synopsis: Two brothers use alchemy in search of the Philosopher’s Stone after a forbidden ritual costs them their bodies.

title: Death Note, Vol. 1: Boredom
author: Tsugumi Ohba & Takeshi Obata
synopsis: A high school student gains a notebook that kills anyone whose name is written in it and decides to reshape the world.

title: Naruto, Vol. 1: Uzumaki Naruto
author: Masashi Kishimoto
synopsis: A troublemaking ninja‑in‑training dreams of becoming leader of his village despite the demon fox sealed inside him.

title: One Piece, Vol. 1: Romance Dawn
author: Eiichiro Oda
synopsis: A boy whose body gained rubber powers sets sail to find the world’s greatest treasure and become Pirate King.

title: Attack on Titan, Vol. 1
author: Hajime Isayama
synopsis: Humanity hides behind massive walls to survive against man‑eating giants until a new breach changes everything.

title: Berserk, Vol. 1
author: Kentaro Miura
synopsis: A lone black‑sworded mercenary battles monsters and men alike in a relentlessly dark medieval world.

title: 20th Century Boys, Vol. 1
author: Naoki Urasawa
synopsis: A group of childhood friends realize a doomsday cult may be reenacting symbols from a story they once made up.

title: Spy x Family, Vol. 1
author: Tatsuya Endo
synopsis: A spy forms a fake family for a mission, unaware his wife is an assassin and his adopted daughter is a telepath.

title: Vinland Saga, Vol. 1
author: Makoto Yukimura
synopsis: A young Viking warrior seeks revenge against the mercenary leader who killed his father.

title: InuYasha, Vol. 1
author: Rumiko Takahashi
synopsis: A modern‑day schoolgirl is pulled into Japan’s feudal era, where she teams up with a half‑demon to recover shards of a powerful jewel.
